title: Expansion Plan 2
statementHtml:
You are analyzing an infinite grid with coordinates (X,Y)(X,Y) (specifically, the cell immediately above (0,0)(0,0) is (0,1)(0,1), and the cell immediately on the right of (0,0)(0,0) is (1,0)(1,0)). Initially, only the cell at (0,0)(0,0) is black.

You are given a string a1a2…ana1a2…an of length nn consisting of characters "4""4" and "8""8", which describes nn expansion operations. For each ii from 11 to nn, the following happens for all cells simultaneously:

Is the cell (x,y)(x,y) black at the end of the process?
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains three integers nn, xx, yy (1≤n≤2⋅105,−109≤x,y≤1091≤n≤2⋅105,−109≤x,y≤109) — the number of expansion operations, and the xx and yy coordinates of the cell you are interested in, respectively.

The second line of each test case contains a string ss of length nn consisting of characters "4""4" and "8""8" — the types of expansion operations.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.
outputSpecHtml:
For each test case, output YESYES if the cell (x,y)(x,y) is black after the expansion operations described by the string ss, and NONO otherwise.

The judge is case-insensitive (for example, YESYES, YesYes, yesyes, yEsyEs will all be recognized as positive answers).
noteHtml:
The first three test cases are illustrated below:

In the first test case, after the expansion operations in the string "888""888", cell (3,3)(3,3) is black, so the answer is YESYES.

In the second test case, cell (5,1)(5,1) is white after the expansion operations in the string "4884""4884".
